subject: RE: [junit] Determining which test cases are the slowest
msgSnippet: SilverMark s Test Mentor - Java Edition (www.javatesting.com) runs JUnit tests. As a side effect, it will tell you how long each JUnit test case takes to run,
messageBody:
SilverMark's Test Mentor - Java Edition (www.javatesting.com) runs JUnit
tests. As a side effect, it will tell you how long each JUnit test case
takes to run, as well as which methods it covers.

^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
Mike Silverstein
SilverMark, Inc.
The object testing company
http://www.silvermark.com

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Erik Hanson [mailto:ehanson@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, January 30, 2002 1:07 PM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Determining which test cases are the slowest
>
>
> We have lots of test cases and the entire suite takes way too long to run.
>
> Does anyone know of a tool that will time the execution of each
> test case so
> we can start refactoring the slowest tests?
>
>
> Erik
>
